Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw detailed representations of different types of habitats, accurately showing both land habitats like a playground or garden and water habitats like a pond or stream.
The student can include a wide variety of living things in their drawing, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can depict animals clearly, providing examples like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams with distinct characteristics.
The student can illustrate the diversity of plants and animals living in different habitats, accurately depicting the variety found in each environment.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate patterns showing where different types of plants and animals are found (e.g., aquatic plants in ponds, terrestrial animals in gardens).
The student can organize and label their drawings clearly, showing different habitats and the living things within them with accuracy.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally overlook labeling a less prominent organism or plant, though this is rare and doesn't detract from overall understanding (e.g., forgetting to label a clump of grass).
